title: Flyingjack123
author: Flyingjack123
content: Hello, I am a nontechnical newbie with medical background. My coding or computer education is almost nil. I want to learn about bitcoin and everything in crypto. What are the suitable resources I can follow? Thanks in advance..

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: You can start here: https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Or you if love reading books: https://aantonop.com/books/iom/The first link can give you the core concept of what bitcoin actually is starting from simple up to the most technical stuff, while the internet of money is more of like philosophical concept regarding bitcoin.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: If you are starting from zero then you should first learn the basics about bitcoin, what it is, choose a wallet, secure a wallet, send/receive coins, etc. The resources on bitcoin.org are helpful to get you started: https://bitcoin.org/en/getting-startedIf you want to dive deeper the book called "Mastering Bitcoin" by "Andreas Antonopoulos" is a good place to start learning more about the technical stuff in bitcoin: https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbookFrom there, it's just a matter of searching and studying different details such as the cryptography (hash algorithms, elliptic curve cryptography, ...). It all depends on how far you want to go.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Mastering bitcoin (pooya87 gave a link above). You can read it in some local languages: Few translations of Mastering BitcoinMastering the Lightning NetworkLopp.net's Bitcoin informationThe Internet of Money and its websiteBitcoins Related Books (Updated)LittlebitcoinbookI believe it is abundant for your start.

comments.author: BlockchainMentors
comments.body: Learning bitcoin from an investment point of view doesn’t require you to learn every thing.You have to be able to know basics of how blockchains work , smart contracts , Dapps , DeFi and NFTs and meme coins these are the few spaces you should have a fair idea about.Then you try finding coins or projects that are working on rectifying issues in the current system and are undervalued when compared to their peers in market cap. You look at how actively the team is working and how much they are promoting themselves and spending on ads. What kinds of acquisitions they are making and if any institution is considering or has already been in tie up with them. Then do they grab interest of influential people. Then how good is the future scope of the project, will it stay viable long term basis.For all of this you can go through Reddit , Quora and YouTube channels of prominent people in this field. Also watch only content with a from a credible platform, these days 1 year olds are explaining how to invest in cryptos , so better stay away from getting scammed

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: BlockchainMentors on July 06, 2022, 05:34:30 AMThen you try finding coins or projects that are working on rectifying issues in the current system and are undervalued when compared to their peers in market cap.You can not do that with "basic" understanding of the technology. Otherwise you'd end up brainwashed by pretty advertisement where they first create a fake problem (eg. "bitcoin is slow" or "bitcoin uses too much energy") then introduce you to their own scam coin that supposedly fixes those fake problems (eg. a shitcoin "faster than bitcoin" or one using the fundamentally flawed "PoS algorithm"). When you are fooled into buying that shitcoin, they dump their premined coins on you and make a lot of profit while you end up holding worthless bags.

comments.body: Read through the e-books shared above and share your knowledge here for a better explanation. Consistency is the tool you need to improve faster.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: There is a separate site working on educating people. Find the required course and start learning at Cryptodetail. Here you've got fundamentals, cryptocurrency mining, altcoins, exchanges, wallets, blockchain and more other. Everything is provided in a much easier way to understand. Even the non technical people will understand the basics upon which the network is operating.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Good starting point is an excellent @fillippone's 5 Resources to teach Average Joe about Bitcoin topic which is aimed at exactly your profile of users. I would just like to add that you don't have to have in-depth knowledge about bitcoin to start using it. All you need is basics on how to store them securely, and how to send without overpaying fees and you are good to go.

comments.author: fillippone
comments.body: I might add a few word to all the excellent suggestion above.Take your time.Don’t rush.We are still very early in the bitcoinisation process, don’t rush making investments until you don’t understand at leat the basic concepts.Read the forum, study, ask questions. When you are confident, start with a small sum so you can practice with wallets, private keys.Then start buying small amounts over fixing periods (something called Dollar-Cost-averaging) and go on studying.Bitcoin can be a very complex matter, you’ll stumble in very different points of view. You will fined your own.And, above all, doubt of every investment tips, of course. Everyone want to put their greasy hands on your precious satoshi’s!OMG! Me included!

Coinbase has one if you can,,, I see also from Binance.Problem is they want you to use their product (exchange).Independent one I know a new one is LearnCrypto.com it has many TLDR sections you can check.
